page.title: 14British Gas
page.content: The British Gas buildings were built in 1967, and opened in 1968.The Cromford Canal was blocked off to make the works. It was on the site of Clay Cross Iron and Steel works. Before 1973 the works produced and distributed town gas,but since then people have used natural gas because it is cleaner , and more convenient, but it was so dangerous because it had no smell so they gave it a special smell to see when the pipes have bust or when they is a leak. They have a little bit of liquified natural gas left in storage tanks but next year that will be gone to, so now the British Gas is used as a maintenance centre. They mend pipes all over the country.
